experiment

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • experiment.Block
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Block
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represent a single Block from an experimentation. It contains all the trials to be presented to a subject. It is a single child to the Experiment Class. While there are some preset for the parameters of the experimentation, the designer can modify these presets for individual blocks. The SittingManager will interact with this class to assign the order in which to play the blocks. You can alter some of the value of some parameters giving by the Experiment class
    Author:
    Jean-Etienne Salois, Philippe De Seve
    See Also:
    Experimentation, Trial, Parameter, SittingManager, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • m_blockParameters

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Class,Parameter> m_blockParameters
        Complete list of all the parameters affecting the block. This list should be inherited from the presets of the experimentation. The designer can then decide whether or not for a particular block to enable the parameters.
        See Also:
        Experimentation, Parameter

      • m_trials

        private java.util.LinkedList<Trial> m_trials
        Complete list of all the trials the experiment will present.
        See Also:
        Trial

      • m_name

        private java.lang.String m_name
        Name representing the block for the user. It is automatically assigned and can be changed by the user while designing the experimentation.

      • m_isPractice

        private java.lang.Boolean m_isPractice
        Specifies if the block is a practice block.

      • m_hasRetroaction

        private java.lang.Boolean m_hasRetroaction
        Specifies if the block has retroaction.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Block

        public Block()
        Default constructor. The default block has no trials, has no presets, is not a practice block, has no retroaction, and it is named "Block par default". It should be avoided.

      • Block

        public Block(Block blockToCopy)
        Copy constructor, generates an identical block with ("copie") added to its name. The composing elements of the block are cloned, they are not the same instances.
        Parameters:
        blockToCopy - The block to be used to instantiate the new one.

      • Block

        public Block(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Class,Parameter> presets)
        This constructor takes the presets parameters from the experimentation and instantiate its own list of parameters to affect the block.
        Parameters:
        presets - the presets parameters from the experimentation

      • setHasRetroaction

        public void setHasRetroaction(java.lang.Boolean state)
        Setter for m_hasRetroaction. The retroaction will only be set to true if the block is a practice block (having its field m_isPractice being true).
        Parameters:
        state - if the block has retroaction.
        See Also:
        m_hasRetroaction

        public boolean createRandomTrial()

        Returns:
        if the creation and the insertions was successfully done
